reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a trip to Italy and some tickets to the opera 'Aida' in Verona in June 2011. Hotels can be difficult to source in Verona during the opera festival (especially a half decent one that is located closely to the centre) but we really hit lucky online and got a booking for Hotel San Luca for 2 nights. It's location is superb - just a few steps from Piazza Bra and the Ampitheatre. The rooms are a little outdated and 'chintzy' but so are a lot of Italian hotels in my experience. The hotel itself is calm and peaceful. We would definitely return here again when we come to Verona. I can't fault it on location or comfort although the breakfast is mediocre. However, because of it's location, it's so close to so many eaterie's that you will find lots of places to choose from so close to the hotels doorstep.
reviews.title: Excellent Location,

reviews.text: I really liked this place. Very simple, nothing fancy, but friendly and helpful staff, very clean rooms (better than expected for the price), the breakfast was nice (without being amazing) and location perfect, at the gate of the old town, but not on the touristic sector.
reviews.title: excellent location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently made an unplanned stop in Verona after our plans had changed. Hotel San Luca offers comfortable quiet rooms and a perfect location for exploring the city center. Internet access in the rooms, not the norm in other places around Italy. The breakfast was average, but many other restaurants nearby. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location just steps from Piazza Bra and 15 min walk from train station. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit outdated (not the bathroom- it was beautiful) but the lobby is lovely. I asked for a expresso in the lobby and later found out it was complimentary. The staff provided wine glasses as I had brought some wine. The hotel has a small quaint feeling and is very clean. The breakfast is nothing special but was included in the price. There is a safe in the room and they provide a hair dryer. There is excellent free wifi in the rooms. We didn't have a view so I can't speak for that. Overall I was very pleased and would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyable hotel

reviews.text: Great location, just a few minutes walk from Piazza Bra and within walking distance of all the main attractions. It's about 50 - 20 minutes walk from the train station but there are lots of buses and there is a bus-stop nearby. The staff were friendly, the room and bathroom good-sized and very clean. The breakfast was good, though surprisingly the coffee while plentiful wasn't great, but that's only a minor quibble. A good place to stay in a charming city.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.text: Hotel San Luca was a fabulous place to say.
reviews.title: Central & Cosy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was adequate, staff friendly and it provided a fantastic base for exploring Verona.
reviews.title: Nice views of the city from your room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is centrally located and easy to find. Great walking distance from the train station.
reviews.title: it is good but...

reviews.text: As a single traveler I found the hotel just perfect, in a quiet safe side street with numerous restaurants very close by.
reviews.title: Good hotel in quiet by-road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, the shower fantastic.
reviews.title: Ideal Location - Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel excels in many ways: the location is perfect (a two minute walk to the arena, a fifteen minute walk from the station), the staff are very friendly and helpful, and the rooms are very clean and spacious. We had everything we needed and when we made special requests, such as extra pillows, the staff were very forthcoming.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is very little that could be improved, but the only minor factors stopping me from giving it the full 5/5 is the following: the do not disturb sign was ignored and the staff cleaned our room anyway (this was not a significant incident for us as we had already left the hotel, but if we had still been asleep this may have created more of a disturbance); there was some kind of generator in the courtyard our room faced on to that meant we could not have the window open at night (we did not consider this enough of an annoyance to complain to the hotel staff, and I have no doubt they would have dealt with the issue quickly and without fuss if we had).
reviews.title: Hotel San Luca - Where are you

reviews.text: Overall, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this venue for 7 nights whilst we were travelling through northern Italy just before Easter. Arrived in Verona by train and headed off to the city centre without a map of the city. Eventually found the tourist information centre off Piazza Bra and identified the street in which the hotel is located. Street numbering system is very confusing and after finally asking a local resident where the hotel was located, He was able to explain where we needed to go. It is noted that we were not the first travellers to have experienced similar difficulty in finding the hotel. It may be in the Hotel's interests to provide something to assist travellers in this regard eg. signage on Corso Porta Nuova.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, well situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A refurbishment of the Hotel appears to have been completed in the not to distant past and rooms are well appointed. The Hotel is very well located with it being only a couple of minutes walk to Piazza Bra. Breakfast facilites are satisfactory with items being refreshed very regularly.
reviews.title: A really good 3-star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is good. Stayed 4 nites. Rooms are more than adequate, clean and quiet. Breakfast is fine. The staff met all our needs. They have parking but it is like driving into the catacombs. They assign you a guide for getting in an out. Parking costs about 20 Euro/nite (ouch). Driving in and out of Verona is not that bad, but don't try it without a GPS.
reviews.title: Great location
Adequate and perfect location - very poor attitude towards customers
reviews.text: The location is perfect for exploring the city center. It is about a 20 min walk to the train station (which we used for visiting Vicenza).

I didn't appreciate at all that they went ahead and charged my credit card also for another colleague I was traveling with even though I asked them not to. Their "too late" response was infuriating I have to admit? Other than that a basic hotel with a poor breakfast also. If you watch your credit card, the rest is OK
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great little hotel located in a quiet side of the street, very close to the Arena and all the tourist attractions, 15 minutes walk from the train station and easy to find. There is a supermarket nearby.
reviews.title: An absolute gem!

reviews.text: Breakfast was not as bad as we thought, although we've had better. Cleaning service is excellent, always came back with a spotless room, even folded our clothes! Room and bathroom are small but not too bad. We had a mini balcony so it was nice to have some sunshine into the room. Extremely helpful staff, speak very good english.
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable hotel
